page.title: 05UNEMPLOYMENT - WEST DEWSBURY
page.content: There are over{4,500}unemployed people in the area. This is because large engineering, textile and other assorted manufacturing businesses are suffering from a{lack of demand}for their goods, resulting in{closures and {redundancies.} School leavers, in particular, have found it difficult to gain employment. This situation has led to feelings of{ {frustration}and low morale especially in the Ravensthorpe, Boothroyd and Dewsbury Moor areas. Unemployment benefit of Â£27 per week for a single person and Â£44 per week for a married couple is considered pitifully low and many people are forced to claim{rent {and rate rebates.}There are more jobs available in some{service industries e.g. hotels, bars, cateriing, social services, home helps, but most of these are only temporary.
